text: Gernot Roll (9 April 1939 – 12 November 2020) was a German cinematographer and movie director. He was born in Dresden, Germany. He worked with Edgar Reitz and Sönke Wortmann. His best known works were The Last Escape, Zero Hour, The Buddenbrooks, Heimat, Der bewegte Mann, Beyond Silence and Nowhere in Africa.
